text: And you can find even more by typing "Python tutorial" in the SO search box.
I recently wrote a paper for Linux Magazine (France) on learning Python, and I had to ask myself the same question and do a thorough research on this.
My recommendation is to check the sources below in the following order:
I will also recomment you to read the python cookbook, a really nice book full of recipes that will help you on several tasks.
I would suggest the following Books, these are all for Python 2
"A Byte of Python"
"Python 101 -- Introduction to Python"
"Building Skills in Python --- A Programmer's Introduction to Python"
"Python 201 -- (Slightly) Advanced Python Topics"
"How to Think Like a Computer Scientist ---Learning with Python 2nd Edition"
"Python Programming"
If you intend to learn Python 3 instead of Python 2.x (the difference is not large), you should take a look at Dive Into Python 3.
It's currently being written (by Mark Pilgrim) and is around 50% complete.
